repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Updates some of the error messages to include the improvements from #24393, and removes the code that used to generate specific diagnostics since those are now coming from `treesitter.c`.

comment_regular_data.body: @clason lmk if this is what you had in mind ;)
Now _that's_ a proper diffstat ;)

Nice! Would it be possible to strip the leading "Query error at x:y. "? That's kinda redundant with the virtual text, and eats valuable space.

The `x:y` could also be used to put the virtual text in the exact position for multi-line patterns.

In any case, a nice improvement already!
@lewis6991

> Won’t the virtual text always be appended at the end of the line? Yes, but the first line rather than the line `x`. Here's what I mean: The actual error is in the second line (column 10), but the virtual text is in the first line of the range. Come to think of it, you may also strip everything after (and including) the colon, as that is also shown. So in this case, I'd hope for it to just show > Invalid capture name "onstant.builtin" next to the second line. (Just to be clear, the diagnostic range should also be adjusted then so the red underline only affects the wrong node or capture name.)

@clason I agree with removing the information after the colon, but I do find the position information helpful. What do you think of `2:10: Invalid capture name "onstant.builtin"`?

As for modifying the range, that might be trickier since right now we just [use the range of the problematic node](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/4d1fed3ac841a5d0ae99a157723fd537c7b3a1b0/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_query_linter.lua#L32). I guess I can add extra stuff to better narrow the range...

> but I do find the position information helpful. 

Interesting. How so? Isn't it redundant with the actual thing right next to it?

> As for modifying the range, that might be trickier since right now we just [use the range of the problematic node](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/4d1fed3ac841a5d0ae99a157723fd537c7b3a1b0/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_query_linter.lua#L32). I guess I can add extra stuff to better narrow the range...

Ah, it seemed to me like it just marked the whole pattern instead of the affected node. But this is not a biggie; was just a "nice to have" thought.

> Interesting. How so? Isn't it redundant with the actual thing right next to it?

Right but given the limited space having the exact position (including the column number) right at the beginning of the error is helpful. With all the parentheses it's easy to get lost in these queries :D
Is that what diagnostic highlights are for?
@lewis6991 are you referring to my position comment? I don't feel to strongly about it BTW, I'm fine with removing it.

> right at the beginning of the error is helpful. With all the parentheses it's easy to get lost in these queries :D

I'm not sure how you can get lost since diagnostics have highlights. Also this position information should be stored in the diagnostic so if you want this information in the virtual text then all you need is a custom virt text handler to display it.

> I'm not sure how you can get lost since diagnostics have highlights.

@lewis6991 right, but given that the query editor highlights the entire node instead of just the problematic bit (e.g. the invalid capture name), I find the position helpful.

> Also this position information should be stored in the diagnostic so if you want this information in the virtual text then all you need is a custom virt text handler to display it.

This doesn't bother me enough to write a custom virtual text handler for the query editor.

But again, I'm fine with it. I'll remove it and go with @clason's original suggestion.

> @lewis6991 right, but given that the query editor highlights the entire node instead of just the problematic bit (e.g. the invalid capture name), I find the position helpful.

That sounds like something we should fix. I kinda thought that was the point of this PR.
@lewis6991 the point of this PR was to update the diagnostics from the query linter to take advantage of the changes from #24393.

>  but given that the query editor highlights the entire node instead of just the problematic bit (e.g. the invalid capture name), I find the position helpful.

Yes; to be clear, I was suggesting to change that. ("Suggesting" being the key word here.)

> @lewis6991 the point of this PR was to update the diagnostics from the query linter to take advantage of the changes from #24393.

#24393 provides more information on the location of the error, we should take advantage of that.

It's pretty suboptimal to have a diagnostic at position `X` to contain the message `error at position Y`. 

It's not just highlighting that diagnostics feed into, it's also signs, navigation, quickfix, etc.
Sorry, that was my bad. That comment was meant to convey that I will (grudgingly) accept highlighting of the entire pattern, but would prefer a more targeted highlight.
@clason @lewis6991 I will modify the diagnostic range. Sorry for misunderstanding your previous suggestions.
Okay this is how it's looking now:

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: refactor(treesitter): remove duplicated diagnostic code
